lead_paragraph: F.B.I. agents recovered nine stolen artworks on Tuesday with an estimated value of more than $9 million. Two men were arrested. The uninsured works, by Picasso, Chagall, Degas and others, had been stolen from a warehouse in Northridge, Calif., in February 1992, said John Morley, a senior assistant agent in charge of the Federal Bureau of Investigation office in Los Angeles.
